title: Air India plane crash: Toll mounts to 274; 33 on-ground deaths confirmed
content: The wreckage of the crashed Air India flight AI 171 in Ahmedabad yielded the aircraft's black box and additional bodies, tragically raising the death toll to 274. Authorities believe some victims were from the nearby BJ Medical College campus. The black box, crucial for determining the cause of the crash, was recovered from the college's mess rooftop.

title: 'When the last sword strikes': Iran launches second salvo on Israel - watch
content: Iran launched missile and drone strikes on Israel, targeting cities like Tel Aviv and Jerusalem, in retaliation for Israeli military actions. The Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps claimed successful hits on strategic targets, while Israel asserted interceptions and significant damage inflicted on Iranian military assets. Prime Minister Netanyahu warned of further Israeli operations, escalating tensions between the two nations.

title: Plane crash: Daughter says ‚ÄòI‚Äôll pay Rs 2 crore to Tata group, just bring my dad back‚Äô
content: Families of the Air India plane crash victims in Ahmedabad grapple with immense grief and uncertainty as they provide DNA samples for identification. A distraught daughter offered to pay Rs 2 crore to bring back her father, highlighting the emotional toll. Amidst the sorrow, stories of lost loved ones and shattered dreams emerge, underscoring the tragedy's profound impact on families.

title: 'Those who spoke bravely are all dead': Trump says he gave Iran 60-day ultimatum
content: Tensions in the Middle East have escalated as Israel launched extensive airstrikes on Iran, targeting military and nuclear sites. Former US President Trump claimed his ultimatum to Iran set the stage, despite denials from his administration. Iran retaliated with missile strikes on Israeli cities. While praising Israel's operation, Trump insists on no direct US involvement, creating a complex situation.

title: ‚ÄòShe took her right slipper and assaulted me‚Äô: Woman attacks BMTC driver in Bengaluru
content: In Bengaluru, a BMTC bus driver, Atahar Hussain, alleges he was assaulted by Kavya, a software engineer, after refusing to stop at an undesignated location on Sarjapur Road. Kavya insisted on halting near her office, but Hussain cited traffic regulations and a recently relocated bus stop. The situation escalated when Kavya verbally abused and physically attacked him with her slipper.

title: Microsoft's top executive to software engineers: If you're going to work with AI-generated code, you need‚Ä¶
content: Microsoft executives emphasize the enduring importance of coding skills in the age of AI. Aparna Chennapragada argues that logical and critical thinking, inherent in coding, are crucial for collaborating with AI systems. Satya Nadella highlights the need for computational thinking and structured instruction, envisioning a future where everyone is a software architect.

title: 'NEET-PG seats exhausted within minutes': Tharoor urges for extra exam centres in Kerala
content: Shashi Tharoor requests Union Health Minister JP Nadda's help. He wants more NEET-PG exam centers in Kerala. Students face difficulty choosing Kerala cities. Seats exhausted quickly after website reopened. Tharoor highlights potential distress for students. They might have to travel to other states. NBEMS has applicant data. Tharoor hopes for immediate action to add centers.

title: Sunjay Kapur‚Äôs funeral may be delayed due to US citizenship
content: The funeral of prominent businessman Sunjay Kapur, former husband of actress Karisma Kapoor, may face delays due to legal formalities involving his US citizenship, sources close to the family have confirmed. Ashok Sachdev, Sunjay‚Äôs father-in-law and father of his current wife Priya Sachdev, told NDTV that the funeral will take place in Delhi.

title: MCC introduces boundary rule change: What is it and how does it affect the sport?
content: In October 2026, the ICC and MCC will introduce a new catching rule in cricket, disallowing 'bunny-hop' catches where fielders jump from outside the boundary to touch the ball. Fielders can still push the ball from within the boundary, step out, and dive back in to complete a catch.

title: Ahmedabad crash: AI plane was same model dead Boeing whistleblower warned about
content: A former Boeing quality manager, John Barnett, alleged that the 787 Dreamliner factory suffered from substandard parts and reckless practices, prioritizing speed over safety. Barnett, a vocal critic involved in a legal dispute with Boeing, died by apparent suicide, sparking conspiracy theories.

title: Iran strikes back 2nd time: Tehran responds to Israel's Op Rising Lion
content: Iran retaliated against Israel with a second wave of missiles following Israel's Operation Rising Lion, which resulted in numerous casualties. Ayatollah Ali Khamenei vowed consequences for Israel's actions, while Israel reported injuries from the missile barrage. World leaders, including Narendra Modi and Keir Starmer, called for de-escalation, but Iran rejected calls for restraint, citing past inaction on Palestinian issues.

title: Iran fires back at Israel; Netanyahu says 'more on the way' - How the night unfolded
content: Tensions soared as Iran launched retaliatory missile strikes against Israel, following Israeli attacks on Iranian nuclear and military sites. Explosions rocked Tel Aviv and Jerusalem, prompting air raid sirens and shelter warnings. The IRGC claimed responsibility, asserting successful hits on strategic targets, while Israel maintained its defense systems intercepted many missiles.

title: 'Will bring ruin to Zionist regime', vows Ayatollah Khamenei; Israel says Tehran 'never been weaker'
content: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei promised retaliation for Israeli strikes. Tehran launched deadly missiles at Israel. Khamenei assured military readiness. He warned of grave consequences for Israel. Benjamin Netanyahu cited major military operations against Iran. He addressed the Iranian people. Iran launched more missiles toward Israeli cities. Explosions rocked Tel Aviv and Jerusalem. Iran threatened further attacks and warned other countries.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: There‚Äôs a new programming language. It is called‚Ä¶
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently highlighted AI's transformative potential, stating it democratizes programming by enabling users to instruct computers using natural language. He likened programming AI to guiding a person, emphasizing the ease with which AI can now perform complex tasks like writing poems.

title: Shoot-at-sight order at Assam border amid communal unrest
content: The Assam government has issued a shoot-at-sight order in Dhubri, a town bordering Bangladesh, following communal tensions. Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma cited a "communal group" attempting to destabilize the region, including alleged poster campaigns advocating for Dhubri's integration with Bangladesh.

title: Watch: Iran launches massive missile attack on Israel; explosions rock cities
content: Tensions soar as Iran launches a missile barrage on Israel, retaliating for strikes on its nuclear and military sites. Explosions rocked cities like Tel Aviv and Jerusalem, with many missiles intercepted. Israel's earlier assault, involving numerous aircraft, targeted key Iranian facilities and killed top commanders.

title: When simple morning walk becomes struggle: What it might be saying about your health
content: That uneasy feeling during your morning walk could signal underlying health issues. Changes in pace, balance, or leg sensations might indicate vitamin deficiencies, heart problems, diabetes, or neurological concerns. Weak muscles, inner ear issues, medications, and arthritis can also affect your stride, so it's important to pay attention and consult a doctor if problems persist.

title: 'With no Rohit or Virat, Yashasvi Jaiswal needs to play sensible cricket in England': Coach
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal, once guided by Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, now steps into a senior role for India's Test series in England. With Rohit and Virat absent, the young Indian team, led by Shubman Gill, faces a tough challenge. Coach Jwala Singh emphasizes the need for Jaiswal to balance aggression with caution, anchoring the batting lineup in demanding English conditions.

title: Dipika Kakar shares first post from hospital after discharge post cancer surgery
content: Television actress Dipika Kakar is now home after a 14-hour surgery for stage 2 liver cancer and an 11-day hospital stay. Discharged on June 12, she shared photos expressing gratitude and announced she is tumour-free after the first treatment phase. Her husband, Shoaib Ibrahim, shared their relief and acknowledged the challenging journey ahead.

title: AI crash: Govt forms high-powered panel led by Union home secretary
content: Following the Air India flight AI 171 crash, the Modi government has formed a high-level committee, led by the Union home secretary, to investigate the incident's causes. The committee will review existing protocols, assess contributing factors like mechanical failure and human error, and recommend improvements.

title: 'He is someone for the big occasion'; SA batting coach hails Markram
content: Aiden Markram's century has put South Africa in a commanding position in the ICC World Test Championship Final against Australia. Chasing 282, the Proteas ended day three at 213 for two, needing just 69 more runs to win.

title: Israel-Iran war: Netanyahu warns Iran ‚Äòmore is on the way‚Äô after Tel Aviv strikes
content: Prime Minister Netanyahu announced Israel's ongoing military offensive against Iran, claiming the destruction of key military and nuclear assets. This operation, dubbed 'Operation Rising Lion,' follows Iran's missile attack on Israeli territory, which Israel views as crossing a red line. Netanyahu urged the Iranian people to rise against their regime, as fears of regional escalation intensify amid the conflict.

title: 'Housefull 5' BO collection: Akshay Kumar‚Äôs comedy film earns Rs 133 cr
content: Akshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5' box office collections are seeing a dip. The movie earned Rs 6 crore on its eighth day. The total India collection is over Rs 133 crore. The film opened with Rs 24 crore on Friday. Saturday and Sunday earnings were Rs 31 crore and Rs 32.5 crore respectively.

title: Focus on people-centric engagements, India & China agree to mend ties
content: India and China are actively working to improve their relationship, focusing on resuming direct air services and resolving trade and economic concerns. Discussions between officials included the resumption of the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra and trans-border river cooperation. Both sides are preparing for future talks on the border issue and high-level meetings, aiming to stabilize ties and increase mutual trust.

title: Aus assistant coach hails 'exceptional' Markram, Bavuma as SA near historic win
content: Following a challenging day three in the WTC final, Australian assistant coach Daniel Vettori praised Temba Bavuma and Aiden Markram's resilient partnership. South Africa now needs just 69 runs with eight wickets remaining. Vettori acknowledged the difficulty of taking the remaining wickets and expressed concern over Steve Smith's finger injury.

title: ‚ÄòBring it to ruin‚Äô: Iran launches ‚Äòdozens‚Äô of ballistic missiles at Israel
content: Tensions escalate as Iran launches a missile barrage on Israel, retaliating for Israeli strikes on Iranian nuclear sites and the killing of military commanders. Explosions rocked Jerusalem and Tel Aviv, with many missiles intercepted. Iran's Revolutionary Guard claimed responsibility, targeting Israeli military positions. The US had cautioned against strikes that could derail nuclear negotiations.

title: UK: Three British Hindus beaten up in London park in racially motivated attack
content: In a London park, three British Hindu men of Indian and Sri Lankan descent were brutally attacked after being questioned about their origins. The unprovoked assault by three older men, suspected to be Muslim, left two victims unconscious with severe injuries, prompting a police investigation and raising concerns about religious hatred.

title: Air India plane crash: Wrapped in blanket, medico walks out of hostel inferno
content: Aishwarya Toshniwal, a medical student in Akola, narrowly escaped disaster when an Air India flight crashed near her hostel. From her fifth-floor window, she witnessed the horrifying aftermath of the crash, with flames and debris everywhere.

title: Iran airspace shut, international flights from India to take longer
content: Following Israel's attack and Iran's airspace closure, flights between India and the West are facing significant disruptions. Air India flights are being diverted or returning to their origin, impacting routes to and from cities like London, New York, and Delhi. With both Pakistan and Iran as no-fly zones, Indian carriers will have to take longer routes to reach Central Asia.

title: TV anchor not liable for panelist's statement: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has ordered the release of Sakshi TV anchor K Srinivasa Rao, arrested for allegedly abetting defamatory statements made by a panelist on his show about Amaravati. Justices Mishra and Manmohan emphasized the importance of protecting journalistic participation and free speech.

title: India, 18 others abstain; 149 back UN resolution for Gaza ceasefire
content: The UN General Assembly overwhelmingly passed a resolution demanding an immediate ceasefire in Gaza, with 149 nations voting in favor. India abstained, despite key US allies supporting the resolution, while the US and Israel opposed it. This decision follows India's previous support for similar resolutions and recent reliance on Israeli defense technology during a conflict with Pakistan.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Girls, 8 and 4, lose mom and dad within 18 days
content: Arjun Patoliya, 37, tragically died in the AI 171 plane crash, leaving his two young daughters orphaned in London just 18 days after their mother succumbed to cancer. He had traveled to India to fulfill his wife's final wish of having her post-death rituals performed in Gujarat.

title: AI crash: Publish Boeing report immediately, says whistleblower's lawyer to US FAA
content: Following the Air India crash involving a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner in Ahmedabad, attorneys for Boeing whistleblower Sam Salehpour are urging the FAA to release its findings on alleged structural defects in Boeing's 787 aircraft. Salehpour had previously raised concerns about the integrity of Boeing's 787 and 777 planes, prompting an FAA investigation.

title: Gujarat plane crash: 'One of the darkest days in Tata Group's history', says chairman
content: Air India flight 171's crash, resulting in over 250 deaths, marks a dark chapter for the Tata Group, according to Chairman N Chandrasekaran. He assured full support and transparency in the investigation involving teams from India, the UK, and the US. The group is providing assistance to affected families, with Tata Trusts considering financial aid.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Just can't believe my luck, says 'The Man Who Lived'
content: Viswashkumar Ramesh, a British national, miraculously survived the Air India Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad, escaping with minor injuries while all other passengers perished. Recounting the horrific experience from his hospital bed, Viswash described feeling the plane struggle immediately after takeoff before it crashed.

title: Assam: 70 families shifted after blast, gas leak at ONGC rig
content: A major gas leak at ONGC's Rudrasagar oilfield in Sivasagar, Assam, triggered widespread panic and the evacuation of 70 families. The incident occurred during routine operations by SK Petrochemicals, causing a high-pressure release of natural gas. Emergency protocols were activated, with SDRF and NDRF teams working to control the emission.

title: Lost in translation: Hindi statement sinks drug case in Tamil Nadu court
content: A Chennai court acquitted Nag Narayan Prasad in a narcotics case due to critical prosecution errors. The primary issue was the submission of a key witness statement in Hindi without translation, rendering it inadmissible. Further weakening the case, crucial witnesses were not examined, and digital evidence lacked proper certification, leading to the accused's release due to insufficient evidence.

title: Jammu and Kashmir: Row erupts over BJP call to drop Urdu criteria from test
content: A political clash has erupted in Jammu and Kashmir over the mandatory Urdu test for naib tehsildar recruitment. The BJP seeks to scrap the requirement, citing discrimination against Hindi and Punjabi speakers, while the PDP defends Urdu as a vital part of J&K's heritage and official language.

title: Maharashtra: After 'no non-Hindus' call, Shani temple fires 114 Muslim staff
content: The Shani Shingnapur shrine trust in Maharashtra dismissed 167 employees, citing non-performance and absenteeism. A significant portion, 68% of those laid off, were Muslims. This action followed threats from a Hindu group demanding the removal of non-Hindus from the shrine's workforce, though the trust denies any discriminatory intent, stating the dismissals were disciplinary.

title: 'I‚Äôve been in this situation': Magic Johnson talks betrayal amid Lakers ownership buzz
content: NBA legend Magic Johnson recently revealed a past betrayal by a former Los Angeles Lakers coach during an appearance on ESPN's 'First Take.' While discussing the Lakers' playoff exit and potential future ownership changes, Johnson recalled the 1981-82 season when tensions with coach Paul Westhead led to his firing.

title: Kerala high court slams Centre over indecision on Wayanad loan relief
content: The Kerala High Court has criticized the Union government for its delayed response regarding loan waivers for victims of the July 2024 landslides in Wayanad. The Centre cited the omission of a section in the Disaster Management Act as a reason for its inaction.

title: 'Expect several waves of Iranian attacks': Netanyahu after Israeli strikes; US shifts warships
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced a strike on Iranian military and nuclear sites, anticipating retaliatory attacks. He stated the US was informed beforehand, leaving further action to President Trump. Netanyahu aims to cripple Iran's missile production, revealing the operation was delayed. Iran has condemned the strikes as a 'declaration of war,' while Trump warned of harsher attacks if nuclear negotiations fail.

title: Air India plane crash: For 44-yr-old, a rejig in travel plans proved fatal
content: Kalpana Prajapati from Manjalpur, Gujarat, tragically perished on a flight from Ahmedabad after delaying her trip to London to wait for her sister-in-law's visa approval. When the sister-in-law's visa was rejected, Kalpana booked a flight for June 12, a decision that ultimately led to her untimely death.

title: Uttar Pradesh blocks two Urs events citing law & order concerns
content: Authorities in Ayodhya and Barabanki, Uttar Pradesh, have denied permission for two annual Urs ceremonies, citing potential law and order issues. The Ayodhya denial followed a VHP complaint alleging the event was being held in the name of "Ghazi Baba," referencing Mahmud of Ghazni's military commander. Barabanki's denial stemmed from concerns about communal tension and unrest.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: For this Anand girl, a change of flight was a change of fate
content: Pinal Mistry, a 24-year-old from Anand, tragically became a victim of the Air India flight due to a last-minute change in her travel plans. She had been in India for dental treatment following a car accident and was returning to England to resume her online business. Her father, Suresh Mistry, is now awaiting DNA analysis to confirm the devastating news.

title: Grading the Rangers, Ducks on the Chris Kreider trade
content: the Rangers sent Chris Kreider and a 2025 fourth-round pick to the Ducks . the new york Rangers could find a replacement elsewhere . there were many reasons that influenced the decision to move on .

title: Pride of the Yankees: Three days with Aaron Judge on the road to immortality
content: it's been a year of dramatic change for their family, some public, some private . Aaron and his wife, Samantha, don't have a nanny or a night nurse . "naps are tough," he said with a laugh .

title: Fouls, aggression and long shots galore: What it really means to 'get Concacafed'
content: Gab Marcotti and Julien Laurens call out Landon Donovan for his criticism of players pulling out of the USMNT . are you experiencing symptoms of a referee giving you a yellow card for getting punched by another player? have you ever seen a group of ball boys shrug their shoulders and sit, immobile, after a goalkeeper literally punted the ball into the Atlantic Ocean?

title: Mya Lesnar, daughter to WWE legend Brock Lesnar, wins national title in shot put
content: Mya Lesnar secured a national championship in the women's shot put finals at the NCAA Outdoor Track and Field Championships on friday . on first attempt, mya recorded a mark of 19.01 meters (62 feet, 4 12 inches) and would stay in the lead the entire competition . the mark finished as much as five inches and a quarter ahead of the next best competitor .

title: Madrid sign Argentina wonderkid Mastantuono
content: real madrid have signed river plate's Franco Mastantuono . the 17-year-old is with river in the united states for the club world cup . he will join the laLiga club in august .

title: 2026 recruiting class rankings: Rutgers part of Big Ten surge
content: the Big Ten is flexing its muscles on the recruiting trail with 10 teams ranked among the top 25 classes . americans still sit at no. 1 while Ohio State pushes to no. 2 after a pair of ESPN 300 additions: in-state RB Favour Akih and DE Khary Wilder .

title: Sun Belt Conference preview: James Madison looks to close deal this time
content: Coastal Carolina has two in the past five . Georgia Southern is coming off its best season in four years . nearly everyone in the Sun Belt has reached solid to great heights of late . if you have to lose every game, that's an awfully impressive sign of parity and general conference health .

title: The Paul Maurice Effect: How the Panthers coach helped create a monster
content: nosek's fourth-line forward flips a puck over the glass with 1:42 remaining in extra time . he could only watch helplessly from there as Leon Draisaitl scores the game winner . coach Paul Maurice says the feeling wouldn't linger .

title: Storylines, top players and predictions
content: college baseball analyst Riggins joins "the Paul Finebaum Show" to discuss the top two remaining seeds going head-to-head in their MCWS opener . this year's tournament brings a mix of competition, featuring teams from six conferences and one independent .

title: What Carlisle learned in Dallas to help him coach Tyrese Haliburton
content: coach Rick Carlisle wanted to double-check whether Pascal Siakam was fouled . if the review was successful, the Pacers would have possession of the ball . "Get the ball in Tyrese's hands," coach says .
